image.altText: Four types of coloured sand products have been recalled.

props.synopsis: Coloured sand products linked to an asbestos contamination scare have so far been identified at more than 100 sites in South Australia following checks at schools and preschools, the state's education department says.

title.children: Sand linked to asbestos contamination scare found at more than 100 SA education sites

image.altText: a woman inside a spaceship

props.synopsis: When Katherine Bennell-Pegg was growing up, she was "mesmerised by the stars" — an enthusiasm that motivated her to pursue astronaut training, and has now secured an honour of a different kind.

title.children: Astronaut and 'trailblazer' named SA's Australian of the Year

image.altText: Ponds surrounded by boggy farmland.

props.synopsis: A date is set for snorkellers to return Ewens Ponds on South Australia's Limestone Coast, after low water flows caused its closure to the public.

title.children: World-famous diving spot to reopen amid hopes of environmental rejuvenation

image.altText: A pile of glass bottles

props.synopsis: Container Deposit Schemes are loved by consumers for getting a little cash back, but wineries say the financial and administrative burden outweighs any environmental boon.

title.children: Small wineries worried about 'onerous' costs of consumer recycling scheme

image.altText: Kate Hore clenches her fists in celebration

props.synopsis: Melbourne is through to the AFLW preliminary finals as Kate Hore inspires the Demons to a comeback win over Adelaide.

title.children: Hore leads Demons in comeback semifinal win over Crows

image.altText: A Bedford disability support service building.

props.synopsis: South Australian Premier Peter Malinauskas says he will "definitely not" go to Brazil for COP negotiations, and instead will prioritise saving disability employment provider Bedford.

title.children: SA Premier will prioritise saving Bedford over COP negotiations in Brazil

image.altText: A cricket batter in green plays a shot with a white ball flying away from her

props.synopsis: Former Australia captain Meg Lanning and South Africa batter Laura Wolvaardt sparkle in wins for the Melbourne Stars and Adelaide Strikers.

title.children: Lanning dominates in 100th WBBL game as Stars down Scorchers

image.altText: Australian Federal Police officers raid a home.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide paedophile who posted images online "boasting" about his crimes has been sentenced to at least 14 years in prison. WARNING: This story contains details of sexual abuse that readers may find distressing.

title.children: Adelaide man jailed over 'deeply confronting' child abuse offences

image.altText: five workers in a food warehouse arms outstretched in celebration with large containers of fresh produce

props.synopsis: South Australians have punched well above their weight by donating more than 10 per cent of the target figure for a national 'giveathon' on behalf of a food rescue charity.

title.children: South Australians raise more than $100,000 for OzHarvest through ABC Gives

image.altText: A former politician talking to a crowd of people

props.synopsis: Former South Australian premier Mike Rann has sharply criticised the gas industry and warned that "battalions" of fossil fuel lobbyists will be descending on next year's UN climate summit to influence negotiations.

title.children: 'Swarm' of fossil fuel lobbyists coming to COP31, former SA premier warns

image.altText: A close-up of a hand holding a paintbrush and painting a black circle on a red canvas, with paint pots nearby.

props.synopsis: The truth behind claims of "white hands on black art" will be tested in the SA Supreme Court as one of the country's best-known Aboriginal art groups sues Rupert Murdoch's national masthead for defamation.

title.children: The Australian newspaper sued over 'white hands on black art' reporting

image.altText: security cameras on a pole behind a fence with razor wire on top

props.synopsis: A South Australian court has heard that a correctional services executive was "motivated by financial greed" when he planned a $300,000 prison upgrade rort to fund his retirement.

title.children: 'Ambitious masterplan' led to $300k prison upgrade rort, court hears

image.altText: A blurred parking fine on the windscreen of a white car

props.synopsis: A South Australian woman has won a four-year legal battle against an Adelaide council over a $104 parking fine.

title.children: SA woman wins $104 parking fine challenge after over $50k in legal costs

image.altText: Fast bowler looking over his shoulder, walking to the boundary to field

props.synopsis: Australian quick Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of the opening Ashes Test match against England in Perth with a hamstring injury.

title.children: Hazlewood out of Ashes opener in massive blow for Australia

image.altText: Two Palestinian women and a young boy browse a table laden with fresh vegetables.

props.synopsis: The fragile ceasefire in Gaza has now been in place for five weeks. Here is what has changed, what has not, and where things currently stand.

title.children: We're five weeks into the Gaza ceasefire. This is what has changed

image.altText: Bill Clinton speaks on stage with hand gestures, wearing a black suit.

props.synopsis: The request comes two days after thousands of documents were released that raised new questions about Mr Trump's relationship with Epstein.

title.children: Trump seeks probe of Epstein ties to former US president Bill Clinton

image.altText: An image of Donald Trump alongside Jeffrey Epstein projected on Windsor castle.

props.synopsis: A trove of Jeffrey Epstein emails released this week reveals his preoccupation with US President Donald Trump in the years before Epstein's death.

title.children: 'I know how dirty Donald is': What Jeffrey Epstein had to say about Trump

image.altText: Al Hasan Toure vs Colombia

props.synopsis: Australia's hopes of a favourable draw for next year's World Cup take a hit with a disappointing 1-0 loss to Venezuela in Texas.

title.children: In worst performance of the Popovic era, disjointed Socceroos outclassed by Venezuela in Houston

image.altText: A mining machine on a huge pile of earth.

props.synopsis: As Australia races to scale up refining of rare earths, a thorny question looms: where does all the toxic wastewater go?

title.children: How Australia can avoid China's rare earth pollution crisis

image.altText: Andre sits on his couch leaning forward with his hands clasped together looking into the camera.

props.synopsis: A vocal minority of finasteride users speak out about the long-lasting mental side effects of the hair loss drug, as telehealth ads for the medication surge on social media.

title.children: Hair loss drug users say psychological side effects left them 'crumbling'

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: Markets are heading south over fears about the US economy and interest rates not falling. Analysts fear mortgage holders and superannuates are in the firing line.

title.children: $4 trillion in super at risk as market meltdown fears spread

image.altText: Men in tracksuits raise their arms together in triumph, one holding maracas.

props.synopsis: They said it, we published it. Can you decipher it? See if you can work out who said what, and why.

title.children: ABC Quote Quiz: The 'unofficial uniform' of Oasis, a Louvre heist cult hero and fruit shaped like body parts

image.altText: A black and white painting in a thick gold frame of a girl reaching into the air as a love-heart shaped balloon floats away

props.synopsis: The Grove Gallery in London was showcasing a collection of 13 Banksy pieces worth about £1.5 million ($3 million) when the iconic print was stolen.

title.children: Man jailed for stealing signed print of Banksy's Girl with Balloon painting

image.altText: Woman wearing a suit holding her hands out

props.synopsis: Liberal shadow cabinet members landed on a plan that has left many inside and outside the party bewildered and confused.

title.children: There's a conundrum in the Liberal net zero position — and no way to right it

image.altText: Diners in a flooded restaurant watch fish swim around their legs and tables.

props.synopsis: Fish are not just on the menu in this Thai restaurant — they are also swimming around the tables and bringing in diners happy to sit in waist-deep river water while enjoying their meals.

title.children: When this Thai restaurant flooded, business boomed

image.altText: Littleproud gestures with a hand while speaking in a courtyard.

props.synopsis: The Nationals will be meeting with the Liberals on Sunday to sign off on a climate policy.

title.children: Littleproud happy to let Liberals 'dream' of net zero in Coalition deal on climate

image.altText: Andrew Forrest in high-vis and helmet is being strapped into a harness in front of steel stairs

props.synopsis: At a wind farm in central Queensland, the billionaire backer and the local boilermaker offer a glimpse into how the energy transition is reshaping regional communities.

title.children: At Twiggy Forrest's wind farm, 'growing pains' of the renewable transition are laid bare

image.altText: Three gamers sit in chairs in front of computers in a room.

props.synopsis: Japan's education system is renowned for its rigidity. But one school is providing an alternative, blending typical education classes with intensive video game training.

title.children: Japanese students aren't showing up to class. This school turned to video games

image.altText: Asian woman with short dark hair speaks at a lectern with Japan flag behind her

props.synopsis: Sanae Takaichi has been in the top job for less than a month, but her comments detailing what Japan could do if China invaded Taiwan has sparked a diplomatic war.

title.children: 'Cut off that dirty neck': How one comment sparked threats against Japan's PM

image.altText: Two girls, photographed from behind, sitting on a grey sofa watching TV

props.synopsis: We have navigated this new path of "what to watch/what to censor/what to allow" with stumbling footsteps. I'd love to tell you we have been perfectly consistent. We have not.

title.children: Should we let our son watch Mad Men?

image.altText: GettyImages-74010665

props.synopsis: Australia's peak body for equestrian sports received a controversial video of Olympic rider Heath Ryan appearing to whip a horse weeks before an investigation was commenced.

title.children: Equestrian Australia received controversial video weeks before probe

image.altText: An aerial shot of Bento Rodrigues, Brazil

props.synopsis: A British court has ruled mining giant BHP liable for a deadly dam collapse in Brazil a decade ago, which sparked one of the world's largest environmental disasters on record.

title.children: Court finds 'pollutant' BHP liable over deadly Brazilian dam collapse

image.altText: Ponds surrounded by boggy farmland.

props.synopsis: A date is set for snorkellers to return Ewens Ponds on South Australia's Limestone Coast, after low water flows caused its closure to the public.

title.children: World-famous diving spot to reopen amid hopes of environmental rejuvenation
